titleStmt.title: A new ballad intituled, Daniels siftyng in these our dayes aptly applyed to the true preachers of the Gospell. What God hath wylled vs, to that good eare geue: for Daniels are abroad: siftyng with their seeue.

A new ballad intituled, Daniels siftyng in these our dayes aptly applyed to the true preachers of the Gospell. What God hath wylled vs, to that good eare geue: for Daniels are abroad: siftyng with their seeue.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Richarde Iohnes: dwelling in the vpper end of Fleetlane, at the signe of the spread Eagle. And are to be solde: at his shop ioynyng to the southwest dore of Saint Paules Church,

notesStmt.note: A song - "Good Daniels sifting, in Gods church aboute,".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
